Package projects.pqueue.trees

Interface BinarySearchTree<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The Comparable type held by this.
    All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<T>, Tree<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    LinkedBinarySearchTree
    public interface BinarySearchTree<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>
extends Tree<T>

    A BinarySearchTree is a Tree with a maximum of 2 children per node which allows for adding and removing nodes in a sorted manner. As such, it will extend the Tree interface but it will also restrict the objects it stores to Comparable ones. There are only going to be two new methods in this interface: insert(T) and delete(T).

    Following classic semantics, for every given nodes, elements in the left subtree of the nodes are smaller (as defined by their compareTo() definitions) than the element at the nodes, which is subsequently smaller than or equal to the nodes in the right subtree.

    Note that this interface does not allow for methods that balance it. For BinarySearchTrees that allow for auto-balancing, AVL projects.pqueue.trees or Red-Black projects.pqueue.trees should be used.

    You should not edit this class! It is given to you as a resource for your project.

    Author:
    Jason Filippou

      • add

        void add​(T element)
        Adds an element to the tree. BinarySearchTrees impose criteria for insertion (see description of the class), whereas general Trees do not.
        Parameters:
        element - The element to insert.

        Removes the specified element from the tree and returns it.

        Returns:

        EmptyTreeException - If the tree is empty.
